fullProgramDescription: The Aerospace Engineering major at UC Berkeley is designed to provide students with a comprehensive education in the principles and practices of aerospace engineering, including the design, development, and operation of aircraft, spacecraft, and missiles. The program emphasizes the fundamental sciences of engineering, including mathematics, physics, and materials science, as well as the application of these principles to real-world problems.
shortProgramDescription: The Aerospace Engineering BS program at UC Berkeley provides a rigorous foundation in aerospace engineering principles, preparing students for careers in industry, government, or further study.
classHighlights: Lower Division Core Courses: Students complete foundational courses in mathematics (MATH 1A, 1B, 53, 54), physics (PHYSICS 7A, 7B), and engineering (ENGIN 7, 40), providing a basis for upper division coursework.

Upper Division Core Courses: Required courses include Fluid Mechanics (ME 106), Aerodynamics (MEC ENG 131), Aerospace Structures (MEC ENG 103), and Systems Engineering (MEC ENG 134), ensuring a comprehensive understanding of aerospace engineering principles.

Technical Electives: Students select from a range of technical electives, including courses in propulsion systems, flight mechanics, and aerospace materials, allowing them to tailor their education to their interests.

Laboratory and Design Courses: Hands-on experience is gained through laboratory and design courses, such as Aerospace Engineering Laboratory (MEC ENG 145) and Aerospace Design (MEC ENG 146), where students apply theoretical knowledge to practical problems.
learningOutcomes: Apply mathematical and scientific principles to solve aerospace engineering problems
Design, analyze, and test aerospace systems and components
Understand the fundamental principles of aerodynamics, propulsion, and aerospace structures
Work effectively in teams to solve complex engineering problems
Apply ethical and professional standards in aerospace engineering practice
additionalInformation: The Aerospace Engineering major is a selective program that requires completion of lower division prerequisites and a formal application process. Students are encouraged to participate in research and internship opportunities to enhance their educational experience.
